sen.j: 五十瓊敷入彦命（いにしきいりびこのみこと）は、記紀に伝えられる古墳時代の皇族（王族）。
sen.e: Inishikiiribiko no mikoto (五十瓊敷入彦命) was a member of the Imperial family (Royal family), who is said to have been lived in the Kofun period (tumulus period), according to "Kojiki " (The Record of Ancient Matters) and "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan).
sen.cmt: 五十瓊敷入彦命→Inishikiiribiko no mikoto (五十瓊敷入彦命) と漢字表記を入れました。 記紀→ 統一用語リストにはthe Kojiki (The Record of Ancient Matters) and the Nihonshoki (Chronicles of Japan)とありましたが、初出なので他の書物同様、"Kojiki " (The Record of Ancient Matters) and "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan)としました。
sen.e: Inishikiiribiko no mikoto (五十瓊敷入彦命) was a member of the Imperial family (Royal family), who is said to have been lived in the Kofun period (tumulus period), according to "Kojiki " (The Record of Ancient Matters) and "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan).

Inishikiiribiko no mikoto (五十瓊敷入彦命) was a member of the Imperial family (Royal family), who is said to have been lived in the Kofun period (tumulus period), according to "Kojiki " (The Record of Ancient Matters) and "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan).

sen.j: 垂仁天皇の第2皇子（第1皇子は垂仁天皇と狭穂姫の子、誉津別命（ほむつわけのみこと））。
sen.e: He was the second Imperial Prince of Emperor Suinin (the first Imperial Prince was Homutsuwake no mikoto), the son born between Emperor Suinin and Sahohime).
He was the second Imperial Prince of Emperor Suinin (the first Imperial Prince was Homutsuwake no mikoto), the son born between Emperor Suinin and Sahohime).
He was the second Imperial Prince of Emperor Suinin (the first Imperial Prince was Homutsuwake no mikoto), the son born between Emperor Suinin and Sahohime).

sen.j: 五十瓊敷命、印色入日子命（『古事記』）とも。
sen.e: He was also mentioned as Iinishiki no mikoto (五十瓊敷命) and Inishikinoirohiko no mikoto (印色入日子命)("Kojiki").
sen.cmt: 五十瓊敷命→Iinishiki no mikoto (五十瓊敷命)と漢字表記を入れました。 印色入日子命→Inishikinoirohiko no mikoto (印色入日子命)と漢字表記を入れました。
sen.e: He was also mentioned as Iinishiki no mikoto (五十瓊敷命) and Inishikinoirohiko no mikoto (印色入日子命) ("Kojiki").
He was also mentioned as Iinishiki no mikoto (五十瓊敷命) and Inishikinoirohiko no mikoto (印色入日子命) ("Kojiki").

sen.j: 『日本書紀』の編年に拠る。
sen.e: Based on the chronology employed in the Nihonshoki.
Based on the chronology employed in the Nihonshoki.
Based on the chronology employed in the Nihonshoki.

sen.j: 垂仁天皇には狭穂姫という皇后がいた。
sen.e: Emperor Suinin had the Empress called Sahohime.
Emperor Suinin had the Empress called Sahohime.
Emperor Suinin had the Empress called Sahohime.

sen.j: 皇后の兄である狭穂彦の反乱事件の際、兄とともに死を迎えたが、その後天皇は新たに日葉酢姫を皇后に迎え、第一子に五十瓊敷入彦命、第二子に大足彦命（景行天皇）をもうける。
sen.e: After the Empress died together with her older brother Sahohiko in in the rebellion provoked by himself, the Emperor took Hibasuhime as the second Empress, and the first son Inishikiiribiko no mikoto, and the second son Otarashihiko no mikoto (Emperor Keiko) were born.
sen.cmt: 日葉酢姫は統一用語リストではHibasu himeとなっていましたが、他の「…姫」の表記に合わせHibasuhimeとしました。
sen.e: After the Empress died together with her older brother Sahohiko in the rebellion provoked by himself, the Emperor took Hibasuhime as the second Empress, and the first son Inishikiiribiko no mikoto, and the second son Otarashihiko no mikoto (Emperor Keiko) were born.
sen.cmt: in in the rebellionとなっているので片方のinを除去
sen.e: After the Empress died together with her older brother Sahohiko in the rebellion provoked by himself, the Emperor took Hibasuhime as the second Empress, and the first son Inishikiiribiko no mikoto, and the second son Otarashihiko no mikoto (Emperor Keiko) were born.

sen.j: 垂仁天皇30年、天皇が兄弟に対しそれぞれが欲するものを尋ね、兄の五十瓊敷入彦命は「弓矢」を欲し、弟の大足彦命は「皇位」を望み、大足彦命が垂仁天皇の後継者に決まったとされる。
sen.e: In the 30th year of Emperor Suinin's reign, when the Emperor asked each one of these two brothers what they wanted, the older brother Inishikiiribiko no mikoto wanted 'bows and arrows' and the smaller brother Otarashihiko no mikoto wanted the 'Imperial Throne,' and in this way, it was decided that Otarashihiko no mikoto would be the successor of Emperor Suinin.
sen.cmt: 垂仁天皇30年→定訳不明：the 30th year of Emperor Suinin's reign としました。
sen.e: In the 30th year of Emperor Suinin's reign, when the Emperor asked each one of these two brothers what they wanted, the older brother Inishikiiribiko no mikoto wanted 'bows and arrows' and the smaller brother Otarashihiko no mikoto wanted the 'Imperial Throne,' and in this way, it was decided that Otarashihiko no mikoto would be the successor to Emperor Suinin.
sen.cmt: successor of を successor to に変更
sen.e: In the 30th year of Emperor Suinin's reign, when the Emperor asked each one of these two brothers what they wanted, the older brother Inishikiiribiko no mikoto wanted 'bows and arrows' and the smaller brother Otarashihiko no mikoto wanted the 'Imperial Throne,' and in this way, it was decided that Otarashihiko no mikoto would be the successor to Emperor Suinin.

sen.j: 同35年9月、河内国に派遣され、高石池や茅渟（ちぬ）池を始め多くの池溝を開く。
sen.e: In the ninth month of the 35th year of the same reign, Inishikiiribiko no mikoto was dispatched to Kawachi Province and he developed many irrigation ponds and ditches, including Takashi no ike PondやChinu no ike Pond.
sen.cmt: 同35年9月→定訳不明：the ninth month of the 35th year of the same reign としました。 池溝→irrigation ponds and ditchesとしました。
sen.e: In the ninth month of the 35th year of the same reign, Inishikiiribiko no mikoto was dispatched to Kawachi Province and he developed many irrigation ponds and ditches, including Takashi no ike Pond and Chinu no ike Pond.

In the ninth month of the 35th year of the same reign, Inishikiiribiko no mikoto was dispatched to Kawachi Province and he developed many irrigation ponds and ditches, including Takashi no ike Pond and Chinu no ike Pond.

sen.j: 同様に広く諸国をまわり農業を盛んにして人々の生活に安定をもたらし、民から厚く崇敬されたと伝える。
sen.e: It is said that he also promoted agricultural development, traveling extensively from province to province, in order to stabilize people's livelihood, and therefore, he was highly regarded by the people.

It is said that he also promoted agricultural development, traveling extensively from province to province, in order to stabilize people's livelihood, and therefore, he was highly respected by the people.

It is said that he also promoted agricultural development, traveling extensively from province to province, in order to stabilize people's livelihood, and therefore, he was highly respected by the people.

sen.j: 同39年10月、「菟砥川上宮」（うとのかわかみのみや。現在の大阪府阪南市自然田付近か？）にて剣千振を作る。
sen.e: Inthe tenth month of the 39th year of the same reign, he made one thousand swords at Utonokawakami no miya Shrine, which was possibly at the vicinity of present Jinenda, Hannan City, Osaka Prefecture).
sen.cmt: 下列にあった「現在の大阪府阪南市自然田付近か？）にて剣千振を作り」を本列にいれ、文末を整えました。 同39年10月→定訳不明：the tenth month of the 39th year of the same reignとしました。 剣千振→one thousand swords としました。
sen.e: In the tenth month of the 39th year of the same reign, he made one thousand swords at Utonokawakami no miya Shrine, which was possibly in the vicinity of present Jinenda, Hannan City, Osaka Prefecture).
sen.cmt: at the vicinity ofを in the vicinity of に変更
sen.e: In the tenth month of the 39th year of the same reign, he made one thousand swords at Utonokawakami no miya Shrine, which was possibly in the vicinity of present Jinenda, Hannan City, Osaka Prefecture).

sen.j: 石上神宮に納める。
sen.e: And he dedicated them to Ishigami-jinja Shrine.
sen.cmt: 本列にあった「現在の大阪府阪南市自然田付近と思われる）にて剣千振を作り」を上列に入れました。
sen.e: And he dedicated them to Ishigami-jinja Shrine.
And he dedicated them to Ishigami-jinja Shrine.

sen.j: 垂仁天皇は五十瓊敷命に命じて神宮の神宝を掌らせる。
sen.e: Emperor Suinin ordered Inishikiiribiko no mikoto to take control over the sacred treasures of the Shrine.
Emperor Suinin ordered Inishikiiribiko no mikoto to take control over the sacred treasures of the Shrine.
Emperor Suinin ordered Inishikiiribiko no mikoto to take control over the sacred treasures of the Shrine.

sen.j: 同87年2月、老齢を理由に神宝を大中姫に託す。
sen.e: In the second month of the 87th year of the reign, he appointed Onakatsuhime to manage the sacred treasures for his old age.
In the second month of the 87th year of the reign, he appointed Onakatsuhime to manage the sacred treasures for his old age.
In the second month of the 87th year of the reign, he appointed Onakatsuhime to manage the sacred treasures for his old age.

sen.j: 大中姫は神宝を物部十千根に授けて治めさせた。
sen.e: Onakatsuhime granted the sacred treasures to MONONOBE no Tochine and make him take care of it.
sen.cmt: 物部十千根は、統一用語リストではMononobenotochineとありましたが、MONONOBE no Tochine としました。
sen.e: Onakatsuhime granted the sacred treasures to MONONOBE no Tochine and made him take care of them.
sen.cmt: make him take care of it を made him take care of themに変更
sen.e: Onakatsuhime granted the sacred treasures to MONONOBE no Tochine and made him take care of them.

sen.j: 物部氏が石上神宮の神宝を管理する由縁はこのことであるという。
sen.e: This is said to be the reason why the sacred treasures of Ishigami-jinja Shrine was under the custody of the Mononobe clan.
This is said to have been the reason why the sacred treasures of Ishigami-jinja Shrine were under the custody of the Mononobe clan.
sen.cmt: to be the reasonを to have been the reasonに、 was をwereに変更
sen.e: This is said to have been the reason why the sacred treasures of Ishigami-jinja Shrine were under the custody of the Mononobe clan.

tit.cmt: ピリオドを削除（見出しなので不要）

sen.j: 岐阜県岐阜市にある「伊奈波神社」に伝わる伝承によると、五十瓊敷入彦命は朝廷の詔を承けて奥州を平定したが、一緒に同行した陸奥守豊益が五十瓊敷入彦命の成功を妬んで、命に謀反の心ありと讒奏したため、朝敵として攻められてこの地で討たれた。
sen.e: According to the legend handed down at Inaba-jinja Shrine in Gifu City, Gifu Prefecture, Inishikiiribiko no mikoto, once dominated Oshu Province on the Imperial edict, however, as Governor of Mutsu Province, Toyomasu, who accompanied him to Oshu, became jealous of Inishikiiribiko no mikoto's success and informed the Imperial court of a false charge that Inishikiiribiko no mikoto was plotting a treason, and thus, Inishikiiribiko no mikoto was accused as an Imperial enemy and attacked to death there.
sen.cmt: 陸奥守豊益→Governor of Mutsu Province, Toyomasuとしました。 讒奏した→定訳不明：informed the Imperial court of a false chargeとしました。
sen.e: According to the legend handed down at Inaba-jinja Shrine in Gifu City, Gifu Prefecture, Inishikiiribiko no mikoto, once dominated Oshu Province on the Imperial edict, however, as Governor of Mutsu Province, Toyomasu, who accompanied him to Oshu, became jealous of Inishikiiribiko no mikoto's success and informed the Imperial court of a false charge that Inishikiiribiko no mikoto was plotting a treason, and thus, Inishikiiribiko no mikoto was accused as an Imperial enemy and attacked to death there.

According to the legend handed down at Inaba-jinja Shrine in Gifu City, Gifu Prefecture, Inishikiiribiko no mikoto, once dominated Oshu Province on the Imperial edict, however, as Governor of Mutsu Province, Toyomasu, who accompanied him to Oshu, became jealous of Inishikiiribiko no mikoto's success and informed the Imperial court of a false charge that Inishikiiribiko no mikoto was plotting a treason, and thus, Inishikiiribiko no mikoto was accused as an Imperial enemy and attacked to death there.

sen.j: 夫の死を知った妃の渟熨斗姫命（ぬのしひめのみこと）は、都を離れてこの地で御跡を慕い、朝夕ひたすら命の御霊を慰めつつ生涯を終えたという。
sen.e: When his wife, Nunoshihime no mikoto knew her husband's death, she went down to Oshu, leaving the capital, and single-mindedly longed for her late husband, devoting herself in prayer to console the spirit of the mikoto until she died.

When his wife, Nunoshihime no mikoto knew her husband's death, she went down to Oshu, leaving the capital, and single-mindedly longed for her late husband, devoting herself in prayer to console the spirit of the mikoto until she died.

When his wife, Nunoshihime no mikoto knew her husband's death, she went down to Oshu, leaving the capital, and single-mindedly longed for her late husband, devoting herself in prayer to console the spirit of the mikoto until she died.

sen.j: なお、五十瓊敷入彦命は伊奈波神社の主祭神として、現在も厚く崇敬されている。
sen.e: Inishikiiribiko no mikoto is highly respected even today as the shusaijin (main enshrined deities) of Inama-jinja Shrine.
Inishikiiribiko no mikoto is highly respected even today as the shusaijin (main enshrined deities) of Inama-jinja Shrine.
Inishikiiribiko no mikoto is highly respected even today as the shusaijin (main enshrined deities) of Inama-jinja Shrine.

sen.j: 参考までに触れておくと、江戸時代の偽書とされる『天書』は、薨去の年月日を垂仁天皇93年(64年)2月24日 (旧暦)とする。
sen.e: For your reference, it could be of same help saying that according "Tensho (a chronological history of Japan), which is said to be a record falsified in the Edo Period, his date of birth was the 24th day of the 2nd month of the 93rd year of Emperor Suinin's reign (old lunar calendar).
sen.cmt: 垂仁天皇93年(64年)2月24日 (旧暦)→定訳不明：the 24th day of the 2nd month of the 93rd year of Emperor Suinin's reign (old lunar calendar)としました。
sen.e: For your reference, it should be noted that according to "Tensho" (a chronological history of Japan), which is said to have been a falsified record in the Edo Period, his date of birth was the 24th day of the 2nd month of the 93rd year of Emperor Suinin's reign (old lunar calendar).

For your reference, it should be noted that according to "Tensho" (a chronological history of Japan), which is said to have been a falsified record in the Edo Period, his date of birth was the 24th day of the 2nd month of the 93rd year of Emperor Suinin's reign (old lunar calendar).

sen.j: ただし、同書に上記の縁起と関わるような記事は一切ない。
sen.e: However in this book there is no description related to the engi (writing about the history) mentioned there.
However in this book there is no description related to the engi (writing about the history) mentioned above.
sen.cmt: mentioned there をmentioned aboveに変更
sen.e: However in this book there is no description related to the engi (writing about the history) mentioned above.

sen.j: 石上神宮の伝承によると、五十瓊敷入彦命は石上神宮の拝殿から東南の隣地に住み、老衰したので、妹の大中姫に祭祀を継がせようとした。
sen.e: According to the legend transmitted at Ishigami-jinja Shrine, Inishikiiribiko no mikoto was living next to Ishigami-jinja Shrine, in the premise situated to the southeast of the haiden (hall of worship), and when he got senile, he wanted his smaller sister Onakatsuhime to take the charge of the religious service.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: According to the legend transmitted at Ishigami-jinja Shrine, Inishikiiribiko no mikoto was living next to Ishigami-jinja Shrine, in the premises situated to the southeast of the haiden (hall of worship), and when he got senile, he wanted his younger sister Onakatsuhime to take the charge of the religious service.
sen.cmt: premiseを premisesに、 smaller sister をyounger sisterに変更
sen.e: According to the legend transmitted at Ishigami-jinja Shrine, Inishikiiribiko no mikoto was living next to Ishigami-jinja Shrine, in the premises situated to the southeast of the haiden (hall of worship), and when he got senile, he wanted his younger sister Onakatsuhime to take the charge of the religious service.

sen.j: が、神宝を納める庫の高い階（高橋）に、女だてらに上るのはいやだと拒否され、仕方なく物部十千根 大連に任せたといわれている（この祭祀とは、神宝の出し入れもしていた可能性がある）。
sen.e: However, she refused saying that she would not like to climb up to the higher floor (elevated bridge), being a woman, and he had no remedy other than appointing MONONOBE no Tochine, who in the position of Omuraji (one of the important official ranks of Yamato Imperial Court, representing the local ruling lords called Muraji) (the religious service referred here might have included the task of getting in and out the sacred treasures).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。 高橋→定訳不明：elevated bridgeとしました。 大連→定訳不明：Omuraji (one of the important official ranks of Yamato Imperial Court, representing the local ruling lords called Muraji)としました。
sen.e: However, she refused his offer saying that she would not like to climb up to a higher floor (elevated bridge) because she was just a woman; then he had no idea other than appointing MONONOBE no Tochine, who was in the position of Omuraji (one of the important official ranks of Yamato Imperial Court, representing the local ruling lords called Muraji) (the religious service referred to here might have included the task of getting in and out the sacred treasures).

However, she refused his offer saying that she would not like to climb up to a higher floor (elevated bridge) because she was just a woman; then he had no idea other than appointing MONONOBE no Tochine, who was in the position of Omuraji (one of the important official ranks of Yamato Imperial Court, representing the local ruling lords called Muraji) (the religious service referred to here might have included the task of getting in and out the sacred treasures).

sen.j: 前述の事績中、垂仁天皇紀87年2月条にも同じ話が載っている。
sen.e: About the chronicle of achievements mentioned above, the episode about him is found within the article of the second month of the 87th year of Emperor Suinin's reign.
sen.cmt: 事績→chronicle of achievementsとしました。 垂仁天皇紀87年2月条→定訳不明：the article of the second month of the 87th year of Emperor Suinin's reignとしました。
sen.e: About the chronicle of achievements mentioned above, the same episode about him is found in the article of the second month of the 87th year of Emperor Suinin's reign.
sen.cmt: the episodeをthe same episode に、within をin に変更。
sen.e: About the chronicle of achievements mentioned above, the same episode about him is found in the article of the second month of the 87th year of Emperor Suinin's reign.

sen.j: 年をとって亡くなった様に伝えられている。
sen.e: And there, he was said to be died of old age.
It is said that he died of old age.
It is said that he died of old age.

sen.j: 墳墓
sen.e: Mausoleum
Mausoleum
Mausoleum

sen.j: 宇度墓古墳（うどはかこふん。
sen.e: Udohaka Tomb is said to be his mausoleum.
Udohaka Tomb is said to be his mausoleum.
Udohaka Tomb is said to be his mausoleum.

sen.j: 淡輪ニサンザイ古墳とも）
sen.e: (it is also called Tannowa nisanzai Tomb).
(it is also called Tannowa nisanzai Tomb).
(it is also called Tannowa nisanzai Tomb).

sen.j: 大阪府泉南郡岬町淡輪に所在。
sen.e: It is located in Tannowa, Misaki-cho, Sennan-gun, Osaka Prefecture.
It is located in Tannowa, Misaki-cho, Sennan-gun, Osaka Prefecture.
It is located in Tannowa, Misaki-cho, Sennan-gun, Osaka Prefecture.

sen.j: 5世紀後半に築造された全長200ｍの大型前方後円墳。
sen.e: It is a big-scale keyhole-shaped mound with the total length of 200m, which was constructed in the latter 5th century.
It is a big-scale keyhole-shaped mound with the total length of 200m, which was constructed in the latter half of the 5th century.
sen.cmt: 「5世紀後半に」をin the latter half of the 5th centuryと訳出し
sen.e: It is a big-scale keyhole-shaped mound with the total length of 200m, which was constructed in the latter half of the 5th century.

sen.j: 五十瓊敷命の墓と伝えられるが確証はなく、現在宮内庁の管理下にある。
sen.e: Although it is said to be Inishiki no mikoto's tomb, there is no evidence and it is currently under the control of the Imperial Household Agency.
sen.cmt: 原文通りに、五十瓊敷命→Inishiki no mikotoとしましたが、最上列の名称が五十瓊敷入彦命（Inishikiiribiko no mikoto） となっているので、ここでもInishikiiribiko no mikotoとしたほうがわかりやすいのではないかと思います。
sen.e: Although it is said to be Inishiki no mikoto's tomb, there is no evidence and it is currently under the control of the Imperial Household Agency.
Although it is said to be Inishiki no mikoto's tomb, there is no evidence and it is currently under the control of the Imperial Household Agency.

sen.j: 最寄り駅は南海本線「淡輪駅」。
sen.e: The nearest station is Tannowa Station on the Nankai Main Line.
The nearest station is Tannowa Station on the Nankai Main Line.
The nearest station is Tannowa Station on the Nankai Main Line.
